** Amazon-backed electric vehicle startup Rivian Automotive Inc RIVN.O said on Thursday it will build a $5 billion plant in Georgia, its second U.S. assembly plant, as it looks to expand production (Full Story)

** Rivian posted Q3 net loss of $1.2 bln; shares down 9.98% at $98


AFTER-HOURS WEAKNESS IS NOISE

** Piper Sandler ("overweight", PT: $148) says it remains unclear why people sold RIVN stocks based on Q3 results as there wasn't enough new information and co's production numbers aren't important as it's still in an early stage

** "If anything, we think an apparently lower-than-expected capex burden for Rivian's second plant (in Georgia) should more than offset any concerns about near-term production choppiness" - Piper Sandler

** RBC ("outperform", PT: $165) says RIVN is seeing strong demand with orders accelerating but production experiencing a few issues

** "We don’t believe this impacts the medium-term investment case, but it does highlight that RIVN has a lot on its plate" - RBC

** J.P. Morgan ("neutral", PT: $104) estimates RIVN producing 71,000 R1T pickup truck sometime in Q4 FY23, suggesting good clarity into revenue as so long as production proceeds as expected

** "The company did report some supply chain difficulties but nothing systemic and likely on the order of magnitude that other automakers are facing" - JPM

** Wells Fargo ("equal-weight", PT: $110) says RIVN's strong order book supports the production ramp but delivery timelines may be hampered and making customers impatient

** "While the Q4 production delay is disappointing, it's hardly a surprise for a startup & does not change our long-term view" - Wells Fargo


(Reporting by Aniruddha Ghosh in Bengaluru)
